entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 1: "The First Skyscraper"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 1: "The First Skyscraper"
media:group.media:description:
We serve God when we help people who are different from us.
“God does not show favoritism but accepts from every nation the one who fears him and does what is right.” (Acts 10:34, 35).

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 2: "A Long, Long Walk"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 2: "A Long, Long Walk"
media:group.media:description: I will listen when God calls me to serve Him. “Then I heard the voice of the Lord saying, ‘Whom shall I send? And who will go for us?’ And I said, ‘Here am I. Send me!’ ” (Isaiah 6:8).

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 3: "Abram to the Rescue"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 3: "Abram to the Rescue"
media:group.media:description: I will serve others out of love. “Serve one another . . . in love” (Galatians 5:13).

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 4: "Heavenly Visitors"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 4: "Heavenly Visitors"
media:group.media:description: God wants me to speak out for others. “Not looking to your own interests, but each of you to the interests of the others” (Phillippians 2:4).

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 5: "Samuel Speaks for God"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 5: "Samuel Speaks for God"
media:group.media:description: God is glad He made me His child. “For the sake of his great name the Lord . . . was pleased to make you his own” (1 Samuel 12:22).

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 6: "God Wins!"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 6: "God Wins!"
media:group.media:description: I can’t! I can’t! I just can’t do it!” Have you ever felt that way? When things are too hard, whom do you ask for help? Jonathan knew who to ask. Here’s his story . . . “Nothing can hinder the Lord from saving” (1 Samuel 14:6, NIV). God gives me the victory.

entry.title: Bible story "The Lion And The Bear" | Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 7 | Gracelink

media:group.media:title: Bible story "The Lion And The Bear" | Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 7 | Gracelink
media:group.media:description:
Friends, Share with others, and Subscribe to our channel - https://www.youtube.com/c/HopeKidsOfficial I can’t save myself; Jesus saves me. “The Lord is my shepherd, I shall not be in want. He makes me lie down in green pastures” (Psalm 23:1, 2, NIV). If you wanted to know more about sheep, where would you look? TV? The Internet? A book? When he had to write a report about sheep, Jamie remembered something his mother had read to him from the Bible. This is what he recalled . . .

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 8: "God Wins Again!"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 8: "God Wins Again!"
media:group.media:description: I won! I won!” Mikhail shouted. “I made the final point!” His teammates frowned and turned away. Recess was over. It was time for Bible class. Here’s the story they studied. What do you think Mikhail might have learned? “Surely goodness and love will follow me all the days of my life, and I will dwell in the house of the Lord forever” (Psalm 23:6, NIV). When God wins, we are winners

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 9: "The Rock and the Sand"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 9: "The Rock and the Sand"
media:group.media:description: Have you ever built a sand castle on the beach? Even though you build it high and you pat the sand until it is firm, what happens when the foamy waves wash around it? A long time ago Jesus told a story about that.“My God is my rock, in whom I take refuge” (Psalm 18:2, NIV). I am joyful when I build my life on Jesus.

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 10: "Dead or Alive?"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 10: "Dead or Alive?"
media:group.media:description:
We worship a God who gives eternal life.
“Jesus said . . . , ‘ I am the resurrection and the life’ ” (John 11:25).
Have you ever been really, really sick? So sick that you were too weak to get out of bed? Maybe the doctor gave you medicine or a shot or hooked you up to machines to help you breathe. We’re going to learn about a girl who needed more than a doctor to make her well.

entry.title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 11: "Where Are the Nine?"

media:group.media:title: Primary Year B Quarter 1 Episode 11: "Where Are the Nine?"
media:group.media:description: We worship God when we thank Him. “Praise the Lord, my soul, and forget not all his benefits—who forgives all your sins and heals all your diseases” (Psalm 103:2, 3). Have you had chicken pox? If so, you probably had to stay home from school for a long while. If you had gone to school some other children might have caught the disease from you. That’s because chicken pox is contagious—people can easily catch it. In today’s lesson we will read about 10 men who had a contagious disease.
